thread.title: Postseason preview | Region golf
thread.title_full: Postseason preview | Region golf | HamptonRoads.com | PilotOnline.com

author: The Virginian-Pilot
title: Postseason preview | Region golf
text:
REGION GOLF Group 6A South
When: One-day tournament is Wednesday, 8 a.m. start.
Where: Magnolia Green Golf Course, Moseley
The lowdown: There’s no shortage of contenders in a field that includes Grassfield and its three-time conference medalist, Garret Swanger; First Colonial and Coastal Conference medalist Teddy Hoffmann; and James River, which compiled a one-day team total of 316 in the Conference 3 tourney, led by medalist Alex Rohr (74). Swanger fired a 2-under to win the Monitor-Merrimac, while Hoffmann won the Coastal at 1 - under. Kellam – in its first 6A season after moving from 5A – is in the field after winning the Coastal regular-season crown.
Group 5A South
When: Two-day tournament is today and Wednesday, 8:04 a.m. start.
Where: The Hamptons Golf Course, Hampton
The lowdown: Hickory’s Patrick Gareiss won medalist honors and guided the Hawks to the Atlantic Conference team title with a two-day 143, while Maury earned a region bid with a second-place conference finish. Gloucester and Warwick earned team berths after a 1-2 finish in the PenSouth Conference. The favorite, though, is from the Richmond area: Deep Run, a 5A state champ in 2013 and runner-up last season. The Wildcats had three golfers card 74 or under for a 282 in the recent Conference 11 tournament, led by medalist Adam Hade (65).
Group 4A East
When: One-day tournament is Wednesday, 8:06 a.m. start.
Where: Naval Air Station Oceana – Tomcat Course.
The lowdown: Great Bridge gets its first taste of 4A region competition after previously competing in the 5A South Region. The Wildcats cruised to the Conference 17 title led by medalist Kendall Turner, a freshman who helped Great Bridge sweep the top four positions in a 69-stroke team win. Turner shot a 72, followed by teammate E.J Whiten (73). Churchland, as the second-place finisher in Conference 17, also has a berth.
– Jami Frankenberry
